forester

  • Reference

Automated function for explaining catboost models

Source: R/make_catboost.R
make_catboost.Rd

Function make_catboost creates catboost model with default parameters using ranger library and wraps it with the explainer.

make_catboost(data, target, type)

Arguments

data

training set for ranger model. It can be data frame, matrix, data.table or dgCMatrix. Note: data should contain target column
target

name of a target value. Should be character. Has to be in data frame
type

specify weather it is classification task or regression. Should be one of these characters: "classif", "regr"

Value

An object of the class explainer.

References

Explanatory Model Analysis. Explore, Explain, and Examine Predictive Models. https://ema.drwhy.ai/

Examples

# \donttest{
# regression
library(DALEX)

#> Welcome to DALEX (version: 2.2.1).
#> Find examples and detailed introduction at: http://ema.drwhy.ai/
#> Additional features will be available after installation of: ggpubr.
#> Use 'install_dependencies()' to get all suggested dependencies
data(apartments, package="DALEX")

exp <- make_catboost(apartments, "m2.price", "regr")

#> Preparation of a new explainer is initiated
#>   -> model label       :  CatBoost 
#>   -> data              :  1000  rows  5  cols 
#>   -> target variable   :  1000  values 
#>   -> predict function  :  catboost_predict 
#>   -> predicted values  :  No value for predict function target column. (  default  )
#>   -> model_info        :  package Model of class: catboost.Model package unrecognized , ver. Unknown , task regression (  default  ) 
#>   -> model_info        :  type set to  regression 
#>   -> predicted values  :  numerical, min =  1615.674 , mean =  3488.662 , max =  6593.961  
#>   -> residual function :  difference between y and yhat (  default  )
#>   -> residuals         :  numerical, min =  -308.2975 , mean =  -1.643372 , max =  222.5907  
#>   A new explainer has been created!  
# plot(model_parts(exp))

# binary classification
library(DALEX)
data(titanic_imputed, package="DALEX")
exp <- make_catboost(titanic_imputed, "survived", "classif")

#> Preparation of a new explainer is initiated
#>   -> model label       :  CatBoost 
#>   -> data              :  2207  rows  7  cols 
#>   -> target variable   :  2207  values 
#>   -> predict function  :  catboost_predict 
#>   -> predicted values  :  No value for predict function target column. (  default  )
#>   -> model_info        :  package Model of class: catboost.Model package unrecognized , ver. Unknown , task regression (  default  ) 
#>   -> model_info        :  type set to  classification 
#>   -> predicted values  :  numerical, min =  0.4566194 , mean =  0.5768911 , max =  0.762294  
#>   -> residual function :  difference between y and yhat (  default  )
#>   -> residuals         :  numerical, min =  -0.7005523 , mean =  -0.2547343 , max =  0.491428  
#>   A new explainer has been created!  
# plot(model_parts(exp))
# }
